sentence.Network_en: He was a stern critic but an extremely kindly man.

sentence.Network_en: The tug crossed our stern not fifty yards away.

sentence.Network_cn: 我们谨记母亲不许我们在人前炫耀的严厉教诲。

jx.jx_en_mean: have a stronger character and be more able to overcome problems than others

lj.lj_ly: whereas James was deeply wounded by the failure, George was made of sterner stuff.
lj.lj_ls: 尽管詹姆斯由于失败而受到很深的伤害，但是乔治的个性却更坚强了。

jx.jx_en_mean: (archaic)men regarded collectively and in contrast to women

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English styrne, probably from the West Germanic base of the verb stare
Middle English: probably from Old Norse stjórn 'steering', from stȳra 'to steer'

entry.def: Stern words or actions are very severe.

example.ex: Mr Straw issued a stern warning to those who persist in violence...
example.tran: 斯特劳先生向那些坚持进行暴力活动的人发出了严正警告。

example.ex: He said stern measures would be taken against the killers...

entry.def: Someone who is stern is very serious and strict.

example.ex: Her father was stern and hard to please.
example.tran: 她父亲很苛刻，让他满意很难。

entry.tran: 船尾;艉部 from stem to stern
entry.def: The stern of a boat is the back part of it.
If you say that someone is made of sterner stuff, you mean that they have a strong personality and are capable of overcoming difficulties and problems.

example.ex: Whoever this woman is, she's made of sterner stuff than I am.
example.tran: 不管这个女人是谁，她都比我坚强。

means.word_mean: 1. the rear part of a ship
2. the fleshy part of the human body that you sit on;

sentences.sentence: "he deserves a good kick in the butt"
"are you going to sit on your fanny and do nothing?"

means.word_mean: 1. of a stern or strict bearing or demeanor; forbidding in aspect;
2. not to be placated or appeased or moved by entreaty;

sentences.sentence: "Russia's final hour, it seemed, approached with inexorable certainty"

means.word_mean: 3. severe and unremitting in making demands;

sentences.en: They are very stern in their discipline.

jushi.english: Stern discipline did not achieve the desired result.
jushi.chinese: 严格的纪律没有得到期望的结果。

jushi.english: The judge was a stern,unapproachable man.
jushi.chinese: 那位法官是个严肃、难以接近的人。

jushi.english: A smile relaxed his stern mouth.
jushi.chinese: 他一笑就使他那严峻的面孔舒展了。
